newsitem.title: USA: Ford hopes Contour assembly resumes next week.
newsitem.headline: Ford hopes Contour assembly resumes next week.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Wednesday that it hopes to resume production of Contour and Mystique sedans Monday after a parts shortage forced the Claycomo, Missouri plant to halt assembly this week.

Carolyn Brown, a Ford spokeswoman in Dallas, said about 2,500 hourly workers were idled this week when the plant shut its production of 1998 model Ford Contours and Mercury Mystiques. It was the plant's second such halt in three weeks.
The Claycomo plant is the only Ford plant that makes the sedans. Production of Ford's F-Series pickup trucks, which are also manufactured in Claycomo, was not affected.
